1. DIABETES 
Precautions:
Maintain a healthy diet with less sugar and refined carbs
Exercise regularly (at least 30 minutes daily)
Maintain healthy body weight
Avoid smoking and alcohol
Monitor blood sugar levels if advised

When to Meet a Doctor:
Frequent urination
Excessive thirst or hunger
Sudden weight loss
Fatigue or blurred vision
Slow healing of wounds

Serious / Emergency Condition:
Seek immediate medical help if:
Very high blood sugar levels
Loss of consciousness
Severe dehydration
Confusion or difficulty breathing

2. HYPERTENSION (HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE) 
Precautions:
Reduce salt intake
Eat fruits and vegetables
Exercise regularly
Manage stress
Avoid tobacco and alcohol

When to Meet a Doctor:
Persistent headaches
Dizziness
Chest discomfort
Shortness of breath

Serious / Emergency Condition:

Immediate care needed if:
Severe chest pain
Sudden vision problems
Sudden weakness or paralysis
Blood pressure extremely high

3. ASTHMA 
Precautions:
Avoid dust, smoke, and allergens
Use prescribed inhalers correctly
Maintain clean indoor air
Avoid cold air exposure

When to Meet a Doctor:
Frequent coughing or wheezing
Shortness of breath
Chest tightness
Symptoms not improving with medication

Serious / Emergency Condition:
Emergency if:
Severe breathing difficulty
Bluish lips or face
Inability to speak full sentences
No relief from inhaler

4. DENGUE FEVER 
Precautions:
Prevent mosquito bites
Use mosquito nets and repellents
Avoid stagnant water
Wear full-sleeve clothing

When to Meet a Doctor:
High fever
Severe headache
Pain behind eyes
Joint and muscle pain

Serious / Emergency Condition:
Immediate hospital visit if:
Severe abdominal pain
Persistent vomiting
Bleeding from nose or gums
Difficulty breathing

5. HEART DISEASE (WHO)
Precautions:
Healthy diet (low fat, low salt)
Regular physical activity
Avoid smoking
Control diabetes and BP
Reduce stress

When to Meet a Doctor:
Chest pain or discomfort
Shortness of breath
Fatigue during mild activity
Irregular heartbeat

Serious / Emergency Condition:
Emergency if:
Severe chest pain lasting more than few minutes
Pain spreading to arm, jaw, or back
Sudden collapse
Severe breathlessness

STROKE 
Precautions:
Control blood pressure
Avoid smoking
Healthy diet and exercise
Control diabetes

When to Meet a Doctor:
Sudden numbness in face or limbs
Trouble speaking
Sudden vision problems
Loss of balance

Serious / Emergency Condition:
MEDICAL EMERGENCY:
Face drooping
Arm weakness
Speech difficulty

Immediate hospital care required:

7. TUBERCULOSIS (TB) 
Precautions:
Cover mouth while coughing
Proper ventilation
Complete full treatment if diagnosed
Avoid close contact with infected individuals

When to Meet a Doctor:
Persistent cough (more than 2 weeks)
Fever and night sweats
Weight loss
Fatigue

Serious / Emergency Condition:
Immediate care if:
Coughing blood
Severe breathing difficulty
Extreme weakness
